pl.bristleback.server.bristle.validation

Class ValidatorActionInterceptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • pl.bristleback.server.bristle.validation.ValidatorActionInterceptor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    pl.bristleback.server.bristle.api.action.ActionInterceptor<ValidationInterceptorContext>

    @Component
public class ValidatorActionInterceptor
extends Object
implements pl.bristleback.server.bristle.api.action.ActionInterceptor<ValidationInterceptorContext>
    Validation interceptor uses JSR 303: Bean Validation 1.1 specification to validate action parameters. By default, Hibernate Validator of version 5.0.1.Final is used.

    Single ValidatorFactory instance is created using ValidatorFactoryInitializer implementation. Customization of validator factory is possible by creating custom bean implementing ValidatorFactoryInitializer interface.

    In case of validation error, exception response message is sent to client, with payload containing a list of ActionConstraintViolation objects.

    There is a known limitation in bean validation used in Bristleback and it's related with Bean Validation specification. Default actions cannot be validated. More about the issue can be found, for example, in Hibernate Validator documentation - Method constraints in inheritance hierarchies

    See Also:
    Bean Validation 1.1 specification
